Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk koan
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: Red Hat Network Tools spacewalk-proxy-installer and koan bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Network Tools provide programs and libraries that allow your system to use provisioning, monitoring, and configuration management capabilities provided by Red Hat Network and Red Hat Network Satellite. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, systems registered through a Satellite Proxy received a 404 response when attempting to register to Red Hat Access Insights. This update fixes the Red Hat Satellite Proxy configuration to address this problem. Users need to run the configure-proxy.sh script after applying this erratum for the fix to take effect. (BZ#1367918) Prior to this update, performing a kickstart installation of a Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 system from Satellite did not work correctly due to koan not correctly handling GRUB 2 parameters. This bug has been fixed and kickstart now works as expected. (BZ#1208253) Prior to this update, a variety of SSL-related misconfigurations could result in the osad service on a client failing with a cryptic "Not able to reconnect" error. This update adds a link to a Red Hat Knowledgebase article with details on what might be wrong and how to fix it. (BZ#1277448) Users of Red Hat Network Tools are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
